results.title: Thyrotoxicosis: selection of treatment (D)
results.creator_credit: Peter Coltman and University of Glasgow Television Service
results.brief_description: Examines the use of drugs in the treatment of thyrotoxicosis and compares it wit h other forms of therapy. Concludes that the drug therapy is to be preferred bec ause it does the least damage and has the lowest morbidity. This view is supported by diagrammatic explanations. Intended for medical students, hospital physicians and GPs.

results.title: Thundering wheels
results.creator_credit: Yoshi Tanaka, Hideo Kamo and Nagai Eigasha
results.brief_description: A survey of the Japanese National Railways. From small beginnings in 1872, the system has expanded the length and breadth of Japan’s four islands, covering a distance in excess of 13,000 miles.

results.title: Through the eyes of a child
results.creator_credit: Chris Petit, Brenda Crowe and CTVC
results.brief_description: Documentary on early childhood development. How does a child make sense of the world and itself in relation to the world? A mother and her child go about their everyday life: shopping trips, play, all seen through the eyes of the child. Interviews with children and adolescents talking about their earliest memories of developing a relationship with the outside world, their fears and fantasies about the world outside their relationship with their mother. How does a child make sense of things like clothes; everyday objects like a teapot and what it’s for are learned through play. Without commentary, through images we see the relationship of this learning and the bearing it has on relationships developed in adolescence.

results.title: Three weeks in Britain
results.creator_credit: Ronald Spencer and Littleton Park Productions
results.brief_description: A journey through Britain including Wales; the Isle of Mann where the tranquility is broken only by the annual excitement of th Manx Grand Prix; pony trekking through County Down in Northern Ireland; fishing in the highland streams of Scotland and a visit to the historic capital of Edinburgh; and culminating in a grand tour of London.

results.title: Three views from an ivory tower
results.creator_credit: University of California. Dept. of Theatre Arts. Motion Picture Division
results.brief_description: A lesser stone-poet; a scientific builder and the inventor of the ultimate weapon. Each in their own ivory tower thinks they have created their own ideal, and the others had nothing to do with “true creativity” - but they did! Music by Gerrit Bratt. Animation Workshop 1963.

results.title: Three pirates bold
results.creator_credit: Ilya Tolston, George K. Arthur, Victor Kayfetz and Go Pictures
results.brief_description: On the advice of an old sail maker two boys and a dog hunt for treasure on an island in the Bahamas. Discouraged after strenuous but unfruitful digging, they dive for crayfish which they then sell to a local crayfish dealer.

results.title: Three girls at the UN
results.brief_description: The United Nations, an international organisation, is exemplified in the activity of three UN girl guides during one day. An Indonesian, an American and an Iranian are seen performing their duties at the UN building in New York and participating in social activities; a similar life to the 140 other international civil servants.

results.title: Three approaches to psychotherapy II
results.creator_credit: Everett L. Shostrom and Psychological Films
results.brief_description: Film is in three parts with an introduction by Everett Shostrom: Part 1 - Describes client-centred therapy as practiced by Carl Rogers. Shows his interview with patient Kathy and gives a summation of the effectiveness of the interview. Part 2 - Describes actualising therapy as practiced by Everett Shostrom. Shows his interview with patient Kathy and gives a summation of the effectiveness of the interview. Part 3 - Describes multi-modal behaviour therapy as practiced by Arnold Lazarus. Shows his interview with patient Kathy and gives a summation of the effectiveness of the interview. Includes an evaluation by Kathy of her therapy with Drs Rogers, Shostrom and Lazarus.

results.title: Three approaches to psychotherapy I
results.creator_credit: Everett L. Shostrom and Psychological Films
results.brief_description: An examination of three methods of psychotherapy. Dr. Carl Roger’s method of “prising” or trying to come in contact with the patient. Dr. Frederick Perl’s method of Gestalt therapy or maturation in the human personality during the interview, and Dr. Albert Ellis’ method of reason and emotion psychotherapy, which aims at eradicating the self-defeatist attitudes of the patient. Each doctor explains his method, demonstrates it in an interview with the patient Gloria and sums up at the end. Finally Gloria gives her impressions of the three methods.

results.title: Three American ballads
results.creator_credit: University of California. Dept. of Theatre Arts. Motion Picture Division
results.brief_description: A series of humorous sketches and semi-abstract drawings are used to interpret three American ballads - “Acres of Clams”, “Old Dan Tucker” and “John Henry”. The artist, Alfred Kousel, has provided innumerable still sketches which combine colour, a feeling of strength and a variety of emotional effects in harmony with the moods and rhythms of the ballads. The ballads are sung by Cisco Houston.
